author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...HURRICANE BERYL CLOSE TO LANDFALL IN THE YUCATAN PENINSULA... ...DANGEROUS HURRICANE-FORCE WINDS, STORM SURGE, AND DAMAGING WAVES EXPECTED THIS MORNING AS BERYL MOVES ASHORE...
summary:
...HURRICANE BERYL CLOSE TO LANDFALL IN THE YUCATAN PENINSULA... ...DANGEROUS HURRICANE-FORCE WINDS, STORM SURGE, AND DAMAGING WAVES EXPECTED THIS MORNING AS BERYL MOVES ASHORE...
 As of 4:00 AM CDT Fri Jul 5
 the center of Beryl was located near 20.1, -86.9
 with movement WNW at 15 mph.
 The minimum central pressure was 971 mb
 with maximum sustained winds of about 110 mph.
